node.doctext:
[Black Street. No Trade. Gypsies!]
[Do as we say and not as we do.]
[Songs of the Mutants]
[Blank Page]
[catseye]


the porn journal part 2 (completely unedited piece of trash) "the winter evening settles down" i have already seen measures taken to insure the failing seasons, falling houses and dwindling continents "we would see a sign" a story then i will tell you a story my children have grown and left me with checks and letters in my mailbox my teeth are fallen out, my thoughts run unchecked off my tongue, i've no strength in the mornings i am tired of all the daytimes and my silences are spoken of in hallways i've no concentration or color left i can't stand my own mind and feel lost when i'm not alone i am always alone but in the early afternoons i go for long walks to the fields outside my neighborhood potatoes grow there, and currants i wait there, sometimes, to see what will happen and that is the story i will tell when i was twelve years old i was a young man (i am not so young now) you say "we were all young at that age" but it isn't so, you know that it is not so regardless, when i was twelve i sat in this field in the afternoon as i do everyday--as i did today i sat and watched and on this day something happened... (now the story shall spin the poem--you will see) on this day--three weeks from my thirteenth birthday-- just as the evening breeze began to pick up
node.title: catseye
